title.narrative: Peru: Strengthening of the Public Health Emergency Preparedness and Response

description.narrative: To strengthen epidemiological surveillance and public health emergency preparedness in Peru.

description.narrative: Total Disbursement in First Quarter of 2022

provider-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: Schedule 2 Section I A 1: The Borrower shall promptly allocate the proceeds of the Loan to INS through its budgetary mechanisms andin a manner acceptable to the Bank.

Schedule 2 Section I A 2(a): The Borrower, through INS, shall maintain, throughout Project implementation, a Project ManagementTeam (“PMT”) in number and with qualifications and responsibilities acceptable to the Bank, as set forth in the Operational Manual.

Schedule 2 Section I A 2(b): Not later than thirty (30) days after Effective Date, the Borrower, through INS, shall ensure that aProject coordinator, a procurement and a financial management specialist and an environmental specialist are hired to work fulltime within the PMT, and a social specialist is hired to work part-time within the PMT, all under terms of reference acceptable tothe Bank and as set forth in the Operational Manual and in the ESCP.

Schedule 2 Section I A 2(c): Not later than ninety (90) days after the Effective Date, the Borrower shall establish, and thereafteroperate and maintain, throughout Project implementation, a committee (the “Advisory Committee”), with representatives, functionsand responsibilities acceptable to the Bank and defined in the Operational Manual, including, inter alia the provision of overallimplementation oversight.

Schedule 2 Section I B 1: Prior to the carrying out of any activities under Part 2 of the Project in a region under thejurisdiction of a Regional Government, the Borrower, through the INS, shall enter into an agreement with the relevant RegionalGovernment (“Inter-institutional Agreement”) which shall include, inter alia, the obligation of the Regional Government to take orpermit to be taken all actions to enable the Borrower, through INS, to carry out, and provide the necessary technical support forthe preparation and implementation of, the relevant Project activities, all as described in the Operational Manual and the ESCP.

Schedule 2 Section I E 1: In order to ensure the proper implementation of contingent emergency response activities under Part 5 ofthe Project (“Contingent Emergency Response Part”), the Borrower, through INS, shall ensure that:(a) a manual (“CERC Manual”) isprepared and adopted in form and substance acceptable to the Bank, (b) the Emergency Action Plan is prepared and adopted in formand substance acceptable to the Bank; (c) the Emergency Response Part is carried out in accordance with the CERC Manual and theEmergency Acton Plan.

Schedule 2 Section II 2: Except as may otherwise be explicitly required or permitted under this Agreement or as may be explicitlyrequested by the Bank, in sharing any information, report or document related to the activities described in Schedule 1 of thisAgreement, the Borrower, through INS, shall ensure that such information, report or document does not include Personal Data.

title.narrative: Volume and value of scientific epidemiological research annually produced in the country
Percentage of potential public health outbreaks studied as per national protocols and timely reported at national level
Potential public health emergency of international concern (PHEIC) timely reported to the WHO as define in the International Sanitary Regulations.
Number of sentinel sites implemented and reporting weekly findings
Number of regional public health laboratories equipped and implementing PCR testing for COVID-19 and other pathogens
Share of health facilities that report GBV events through the updated surveillance system
Public health officials and selected health care workers trained on the updated surveillance guidelines and tools, and outbreak control measures
Public health emergency response plans elaborated with the involvement of national and subnational authorities and updated every 12months with the engagement of multiple stakeholders.
Report on stockpiles and supply chain for outbreak control and public health emergencies
Updated and adopted national epidemiological surveillance guidelines, including COVID-19 guidelines, NCDs, NCDs’ risk factors, environmental health, mental health, violence and gender-based violence.
Updated electronic reporting surveillance system is interoperable and interconnected
Meetings/workshops performed with the involvement citizen organizations for the update of protocols and guidelines
Surveillance systems established for climate-dependent vector-borne diseases
